str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
Wind, breath, spirit.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 1st Person Plural
str2: Lit: I dip, submerge, but specifically of ceremonial dipping; I baptize.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.
And if, whether. From ei and te; if too.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.
And if, whether. From ei and te; if too.
From Hellas; a Hellen or inhabitant of Hellas; by extension a Greek-speaking person, especially a non-Jew.
(a) (as adj.) enslaved, (b) (as noun) a (male) slave. From deo; a slave.
And if, whether. From ei and te; if too.
Free, delivered from obligation. Probably from the alternate of erchomai; unrestrained, i.e. not a slave, or exempt.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 1st Person Plural
str2: To cause to drink, give to drink; irrigate, water. From a derivative of the alternate of pino; to furnish drink, irrigate.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
Wind, breath, spirit.
